title: The Beginning of Wisdom
shortSummary: Proverbs Chapter 1 introduces the purpose and value of wisdom as taught by Solomon, emphasizing the fear of the LORD as the foundation of knowledge. It warns against the enticement of sinners and highlights the consequences of rejecting wisdom while inviting all to heed her call for a life of safety and understanding.
timeline: c. 970-930 BC - Reign of Solomon, King of Israel

keyCharacters.name: Solomon
keyCharacters.description: Son of David and king of Israel, traditionally credited as the author of Proverbs, presenting wisdom teachings.

keyCharacters.name: The Simple
keyCharacters.description: Those lacking wisdom and understanding, often the target audience for instruction and correction in this chapter.

keyCharacters.name: Sinners
keyCharacters.description: Individuals who entice others to join in evil deeds, representing the dangers of ungodly companionship.

definitions.definition: A reverential awe and respect for God that is the foundation of true knowledge and wisdom.
Cleverness or shrewdness, especially in gaining understanding or discretion.
Those who mock or reject wisdom and instruction, often with contempt.
Correction or rebuke intended to guide someone back to the right path.

outline.heading: Introduction to the Purpose of Proverbs
outline.description: This section sets forth the goal of Proverbs: to impart wisdom, instruction, justice, and understanding, equipping the simple with knowledge and discretion.

outline.heading: The Foundation of Wisdom: Fear of the LORD
outline.description: A pivotal verse declaring that reverence for God is the beginning of knowledge, contrasting the wise with fools who despise wisdom.

outline.heading: Parental Instruction and Warning Against Sinful Companionship
outline.description: A father’s appeal to his son to heed parental teaching and avoid the enticements of sinners who plot violence and greed.

outline.heading: Wisdom’s Public Call and Rejection
outline.description: Wisdom is personified as calling out openly to the simple and scorners, offering guidance and warning of judgment for those who reject her counsel.

application: Seek to cultivate a reverent fear of the LORD as the foundation for all learning and decision-making.
Heed godly instruction from parents and spiritual mentors to avoid the pitfalls of ungodly influences.
Respond promptly and humbly to correction and reproof as a means to grow in wisdom and avoid destruction.
Recognize and reject the enticements of sinful companions who lead to harm and spiritual ruin.

keyVerses.text: The fear of the LORD is the beginning of knowledge: but fools despise wisdom and instruction.
keyVerses.significance: This verse establishes the fundamental principle that true wisdom begins with reverence for God.

keyVerses.text: My son, if sinners entice thee, consent thou not.
keyVerses.significance: A clear warning to resist peer pressure and avoid participation in sinful schemes.

keyVerses.text: But whoso hearkeneth unto me shall dwell safely, and shall be quiet from fear of evil.
keyVerses.significance: Promises security and peace to those who listen to and obey wisdom’s call.
